Setting Your Workspace

The workfile locations defined for a project database, and all of the projects within the database, are stored in a workspace. Only one workspace can be set on a project database at a time, but each project in the database can have a different workfile location defined in that one workspace. When you create a project, you specify the project's workfile location. You can also set the workfile location later.

You can change your workfile locations by setting a different workspace.

To set your workspace:

  1. Select the project database for which you want to set a workspace.

  2. Select File | Set Workspace. The Set Workspace dialog box appears.

  3. Select the workspace to be associated with the project database you selected in Step 1.

  4. To associate this workspace with the project database for subsequent Version Manager sessions, select the Make this your default workspace check box. Otherwise, this workspace will only be active during the current Version Manager session.

  5. Click OK.

Note: From the Set Workspace dialog box, you can also create a new workspace definition.
